intro: Anemonanthea trifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved anemonanthea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant features trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets and produces delicate, yellowish flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
